history.content:
I did CS70 along with CS188 and another session A humanities course last summer and it was doable - definitely a far more challenging course than most because it is math that most of us are not used to. I can't compare it to regular semester course because I didn't take 70 during a regular semester but from taking 170 in the fall, I would say summer was easier to stay really focused on one or two courses rather than during semester where there are more courses to worry about and juggle (and recruiting to boot). I think having one homework a week (albit slightly longer) significantly cuts down on the homework workload as well. Personally would recommend summer over regular course load especially if needing to declare.

---

To offer another perspective, I took CS70 summer 2017. The pace of the course is a downside - I felt we weren't able to spend enough time on certain topics in lecture and had to review notes while doing homework, and the homeworks themselves were pretty long. However, being able to concentrate just on 70 without worrying about other psets and projects was the biggest benefit for me, and it definitely helped me get my head around the trickier concepts - overall a bigger upside than the aforementioned pace issue. Highly recommend trying to form a good homework group as early as possible, it helps a lot.

---

Another perspective here! I took it over the summer after freshman year to be able to declare ASAP and it was one of the best decisions I made. Not only was I able to officially call myself a CS major on my resume but also was able to get a head start on upper-divs and am well on track to graduate in 3 years (pushing 2.5, though). I would HIGHLY recommend taking 70 along with a general education requirement as the class moves fast and doesn't go too deep into discrete mathematics compared to the semester. Also, the curve is MUCH more lenient compared to the semester because of the smaller class size. 10/10 would do it again.
---
I took CS70 over Summer '18 with another 3-unit tech in a different field. I absolutely loved the course and thought there was plenty of time to learn the material with 7 units total--taking it alone will let you dedicate more than enough time to the pretty lengthy homeworks and studying for tests. The course staff over the summer were fantastic and there was plenty of support to go along with the slightly faster pace. I was able to take CS170 in the Fall (did well, 70 was good prep btw) and it really helped with overall scheduling, 8/8 would recommend. I think we learned the material just as well as we would have in a normal semester, if not better.

Hi! Wondering if anyone is willing to share their experiences with CS70 over the summer and how it compares to the regular semester course. Would you recommend doing CS70 by itself over the summer instead of with a regular course load during the fall? Thank you!
history.subject: Thoughts on CS70 during summer?
